16164  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
16165  {
16166  if ((valueAxis->range().upper < 0 && !valueAxis->rangeReversed()) ||
16167  (valueAxis->range().upper > 0 && valueAxis->rangeReversed())) // if range is negative, zero is on opposite side of key axis
16168  point.setX(keyAxis->axisRect()->right());
16169  else
16170  point.setX(keyAxis->axisRect()->left());
16171  point.setY(upperKey);
16172  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atTop || keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atBottom)
16173  {
16174  point.setX(upperKey);
16175  if ((valueAxis->range().upper < 0 && !valueAxis->rangeReversed()) ||
16176  (valueAxis->range().upper > 0 && valueAxis->rangeReversed())) // if range is negative, zero is on opposite side of key axis
16177  point.setY(keyAxis->axisRect()->top());
16178  else
16179  point.setY(keyAxis->axisRect()->bottom());
16180  }
16181  }
16182  return point;
16183 }
16184 
16194 const QPolygonF QCPGraph::getChannelFillPolygon(const QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
16195 {
16196  if (!mChannelFillGraph)
16197  return QPolygonF();
16198 
16199  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
16200  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
16201  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return QPolygonF(); }
16202  if (!mChannelFillGraph.data()->mKeyAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "channel fill target key axis invalid"; return QPolygonF(); }
16203 
16204  if (mChannelFillGraph.data()->mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() != keyAxis->orientation())
16205  return QPolygonF(); // don't have same axis orientation, can't fill that (Note: if keyAxis fits, valueAxis will fit too, because it's always orthogonal to keyAxis)
16206 
16207  if (lineData->isEmpty()) return QPolygonF();
16208  QVector<QPointF> otherData;
16209  mChannelFillGraph.data()->getPlotData(&otherData, 0);
16210  if (otherData.isEmpty()) return QPolygonF();
16211  QVector<QPointF> thisData;
16212  thisData.reserve(lineData->size()+otherData.size()); // because we will join both vectors at end of this function
16213  for (int i=0; i<lineData->size(); ++i) // don't use the vector<<(vector), it squeezes internally, which ruins the performance tuning with reserve()
16214  thisData << lineData->at(i);
16215 
16216  // pointers to be able to swap them, depending which data range needs cropping:
16217  QVector<QPointF> *staticData = &thisData;
16218  QVector<QPointF> *croppedData = &otherData;
16219 
16220  // crop both vectors to ranges in which the keys overlap (which coord is key, depends on axisType):
16221  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
16222  {
16223  // x is key
16224  // if an axis range is reversed, the data point keys will be descending. Reverse them, since following algorithm assumes ascending keys:
16225  if (staticData->first().x() > staticData->last().x())
16226  {
16227  int size = staticData->size();
16228  for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
16229  qSwap((*staticData)[i], (*staticData)[size-1-i]);
16230  }
16231  if (croppedData->first().x() > croppedData->last().x())
16232  {
16233  int size = croppedData->size();
16234  for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
16235  qSwap((*croppedData)[i], (*croppedData)[size-1-i]);
16236  }
16237  // crop lower bound:
16238  if (staticData->first().x() < croppedData->first().x()) // other one must be cropped
16239  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
16240  int lowBound = findIndexBelowX(croppedData, staticData->first().x());
16241  if (lowBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
16242  croppedData->remove(0, lowBound);
16243  // set lowest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of first static data
16244  // point via linear interpolation:
16245  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
16246  double slope;
16247  if (croppedData->at(1).x()-croppedData->at(0).x() != 0)
16248  slope = (croppedData->at(1).y()-croppedData->at(0).y())/(croppedData->at(1).x()-croppedData->at(0).x());
16249  else
16250  slope = 0;
16251  (*croppedData)[0].setY(croppedData->at(0).y()+slope*(staticData->first().x()-croppedData->at(0).x()));
16252  (*croppedData)[0].setX(staticData->first().x());
16253 
16254  // crop upper bound:
16255  if (staticData->last().x() > croppedData->last().x()) // other one must be cropped
16256  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
16257  int highBound = findIndexAboveX(croppedData, staticData->last().x());
16258  if (highBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
16259  croppedData->remove(highBound+1, croppedData->size()-(highBound+1));
16260  // set highest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of last static data
16261  // point via linear interpolation:
16262  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
16263  int li = croppedData->size()-1; // last index
16264  if (croppedData->at(li).x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x() != 0)
16265  slope = (croppedData->at(li).y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y())/(croppedData->at(li).x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x());
16266  else
16267  slope = 0;
16268  (*croppedData)[li].setY(croppedData->at(li-1).y()+slope*(staticData->last().x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x()));
16269  (*croppedData)[li].setX(staticData->last().x());
16270  } else // mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical
16271  {
16272  // y is key
16273  // similar to "x is key" but switched x,y. Further, lower/upper meaning is inverted compared to x,
16274  // because in pixel coordinates, y increases from top to bottom, not bottom to top like data coordinate.
16275  // if an axis range is reversed, the data point keys will be descending. Reverse them, since following algorithm assumes ascending keys:
16276  if (staticData->first().y() < staticData->last().y())
16277  {
16278  int size = staticData->size();
16279  for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
16280  qSwap((*staticData)[i], (*staticData)[size-1-i]);
16281  }
16282  if (croppedData->first().y() < croppedData->last().y())
16283  {
16284  int size = croppedData->size();
16285  for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
16286  qSwap((*croppedData)[i], (*croppedData)[size-1-i]);
16287  }
16288  // crop lower bound:
16289  if (staticData->first().y() > croppedData->first().y()) // other one must be cropped
16290  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
16291  int lowBound = findIndexAboveY(croppedData, staticData->first().y());
16292  if (lowBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
16293  croppedData->remove(0, lowBound);
16294  // set lowest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of first static data
16295  // point via linear interpolation:
16296  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
16297  double slope;
16298  if (croppedData->at(1).y()-croppedData->at(0).y() != 0) // avoid division by zero in step plots
16299  slope = (croppedData->at(1).x()-croppedData->at(0).x())/(croppedData->at(1).y()-croppedData->at(0).y());
16300  else
16301  slope = 0;
16302  (*croppedData)[0].setX(croppedData->at(0).x()+slope*(staticData->first().y()-croppedData->at(0).y()));
16303  (*croppedData)[0].setY(staticData->first().y());
16304 
16305  // crop upper bound:
16306  if (staticData->last().y() < croppedData->last().y()) // other one must be cropped
16307  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
16308  int highBound = findIndexBelowY(croppedData, staticData->last().y());
16309  if (highBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
16310  croppedData->remove(highBound+1, croppedData->size()-(highBound+1));
16311  // set highest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of last static data
16312  // point via linear interpolation:
16313  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
16314  int li = croppedData->size()-1; // last index
16315  if (croppedData->at(li).y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y() != 0) // avoid division by zero in step plots
16316  slope = (croppedData->at(li).x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x())/(croppedData->at(li).y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y());
16317  else
16318  slope = 0;
16319  (*croppedData)[li].setX(croppedData->at(li-1).x()+slope*(staticData->last().y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y()));
16320  (*croppedData)[li].setY(staticData->last().y());
16321  }
16322 
16323  // return joined:
16324  for (int i=otherData.size()-1; i>=0; --i) // insert reversed, otherwise the polygon will be twisted
16325  thisData << otherData.at(i);
16326  return QPolygonF(thisData);
16327 }
16328 
16336 int QCPGraph::findIndexAboveX(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double x) const
16337 {
16338  for (int i=data->size()-1; i>=0; --i)
16339  {
16340  if (data->at(i).x() < x)
16341  {
16342  if (i<data->size()-1)
16343  return i+1;
16344  else
16345  return data->size()-1;
16346  }
16347  }
16348  return -1;
16349 }
16350 
16358 int QCPGraph::findIndexBelowX(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double x) const
16359 {
16360  for (int i=0; i<data->size(); ++i)
16361  {
16362  if (data->at(i).x() > x)
16363  {
16364  if (i>0)
16365  return i-1;
16366  else
16367  return 0;
16368  }
16369  }
16370  return -1;
16371 }
16372 
16380 int QCPGraph::findIndexAboveY(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double y) const
16381 {
16382  for (int i=0; i<data->size(); ++i)
16383  {
16384  if (data->at(i).y() < y)
16385  {
16386  if (i>0)
16387  return i-1;
16388  else
16389  return 0;
16390  }
16391  }
16392  return -1;
16393 }
16394 
16405 double QCPGraph::pointDistance(const QPointF &pixelPoint) const
16406 {
16407  if (mData->isEmpty())
16408  {
16409  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "requested point distance on graph" << mName << "without data";
16410  return 500;
16411  }
16412  if (mData->size() == 1)
16413  {
16414  QPointF dataPoint = coordsToPixels(mData->constBegin().key(), mData->constBegin().value().value);
16415  return QVector2D(dataPoint-pixelPoint).length();
16416  }
16417 
16418  if (mLineStyle == lsNone && mScatterStyle.isNone())
16419  return 500;
16420 
16421  // calculate minimum distances to graph representation:
16422  if (mLineStyle == lsNone)
16423  {
16424  // no line displayed, only calculate distance to scatter points:
16425  QVector<QCPData> *scatterData = new QVector<QCPData>;
16426  getScatterPlotData(scatterData);
16427  double minDistSqr = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
16428  QPointF ptA;
16429  QPointF ptB = coordsToPixels(scatterData->at(0).key, scatterData->at(0).value); // getScatterPlotData returns in plot coordinates, so transform to pixels
16430  for (int i=1; i<scatterData->size(); ++i)
16431  {
16432  ptA = ptB;
16433  ptB = coordsToPixels(scatterData->at(i).key, scatterData->at(i).value);
16434  double currentDistSqr = distSqrToLine(ptA, ptB, pixelPoint);
16435  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
16436  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
16437  }
16438  delete scatterData;
16439  return qSqrt(minDistSqr);
16440  } else
16441  {
16442  // line displayed calculate distance to line segments:
16443  QVector<QPointF> *lineData = new QVector<QPointF>;
16444  getPlotData(lineData, 0); // unlike with getScatterPlotData we get pixel coordinates here
16445  double minDistSqr = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
16446  if (mLineStyle == lsImpulse)
16447  {
16448  // impulse plot differs from other line styles in that the lineData points are only pairwise connected:
16449  for (int i=0; i<lineData->size()-1; i+=2) // iterate pairs
16450  {
16451  double currentDistSqr = distSqrToLine(lineData->at(i), lineData->at(i+1), pixelPoint);
16452  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
16453  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
16454  }
16455  } else
16456  {
16457  // all other line plots (line and step) connect points directly:
16458  for (int i=0; i<lineData->size()-1; ++i)
16459  {
16460  double currentDistSqr = distSqrToLine(lineData->at(i), lineData->at(i+1), pixelPoint);
16461  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
16462  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
16463  }
16464  }
16465  delete lineData;
16466  return qSqrt(minDistSqr);
16467  }
16468 }
16469 
16478 int QCPGraph::findIndexBelowY(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double y) const
16479 {
16480  for (int i=data->size()-1; i>=0; --i)
16481  {
16482  if (data->at(i).y() > y)
16483  {
16484  if (i<data->size()-1)
16485  return i+1;
16486  else
16487  return data->size()-1;
16488  }
16489  }
16490  return -1;
16491 }
16492 
16493 /* inherits documentation from base class */
16494 QCPRange QCPGraph::getKeyRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
16495 {
16496  // just call the specialized version which takes an additional argument whether error bars
16497  // should also be taken into consideration for range calculation. We set this to true here.
16498  return getKeyRange(foundRange, inSignDomain, true);
16499 }
16500 
16501 /* inherits documentation from base class */
16502 QCPRange QCPGraph::getValueRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
16503 {
16504  // just call the specialized version which takes an additional argument whether error bars
16505  // should also be taken into consideration for range calculation. We set this to true here.
16506  return getValueRange(foundRange, inSignDomain, true);
16507 }
16508 
16515 QCPRange QCPGraph::getKeyRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain, bool includeErrors) const
16516 {
16517  QCPRange range;
16518  bool haveLower = false;
16519  bool haveUpper = false;
16520 
16521  double current, currentErrorMinus, currentErrorPlus;
16522 
16523  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth) // range may be anywhere
16524  {
16525  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
16526  while (it != mData->constEnd())
16527  {
16528  current = it.value().key;
16529  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorMinus : 0);
16530  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorPlus : 0);
16531  if (current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower)
16532  {
16533  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
16534  haveLower = true;
16535  }
16536  if (current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper)
16537  {
16538  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
16539  haveUpper = true;
16540  }
16541  ++it;
16542  }
16543  } else if (inSignDomain == sdNegative) // range may only be in the negative sign domain
16544  {
16545  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
16546  while (it != mData->constEnd())
16547  {
16548  current = it.value().key;
16549  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorMinus : 0);
16550  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorPlus : 0);
16551  if ((current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) && current-currentErrorMinus < 0)
16552  {
16553  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
16554  haveLower = true;
16555  }
16556  if ((current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current+currentErrorPlus < 0)
16557  {
16558  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
16559  haveUpper = true;
16560  }
16561  if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars stretch beyond it, we still want to geht that point.
16562  {
16563  if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current < 0)
16564  {
16565  range.lower = current;
16566  haveLower = true;
16567  }
16568  if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current < 0)
16569  {
16570  range.upper = current;
16571  haveUpper = true;
16572  }
16573  }
16574  ++it;
16575  }
16576  } else if (inSignDomain == sdPositive) // range may only be in the positive sign domain
16577  {
16578  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
16579  while (it != mData->constEnd())
16580  {
16581  current = it.value().key;
16582  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorMinus : 0);
16583  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorPlus : 0);
16584  if ((current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) && current-currentErrorMinus > 0)
16585  {
16586  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
16587  haveLower = true;
16588  }
16589  if ((current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current+currentErrorPlus > 0)
16590  {
16591  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
16592  haveUpper = true;
16593  }
16594  if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars stretch beyond it, we still want to get that point.
16595  {
16596  if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current > 0)
16597  {
16598  range.lower = current;
16599  haveLower = true;
16600  }
16601  if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current > 0)
16602  {
16603  range.upper = current;
16604  haveUpper = true;
16605  }
16606  }
16607  ++it;
16608  }
16609  }
16610 
16611  foundRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
16612  return range;
16613 }
16614 
16621 QCPRange QCPGraph::getValueRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain, bool includeErrors) const
16622 {
16623  QCPRange range;
16624  bool haveLower = false;
16625  bool haveUpper = false;
16626 
16627  double current, currentErrorMinus, currentErrorPlus;
16628 
16629  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth) // range may be anywhere
16630  {
16631  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
16632  while (it != mData->constEnd())
16633  {
16634  current = it.value().value;
16635  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorMinus : 0);
16636  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorPlus : 0);
16637  if (current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower)
16638  {
16639  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
16640  haveLower = true;
16641  }
16642  if (current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper)
16643  {
16644  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
16645  haveUpper = true;
16646  }
16647  ++it;
16648  }
16649  } else if (inSignDomain == sdNegative) // range may only be in the negative sign domain
16650  {
16651  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
16652  while (it != mData->constEnd())
16653  {
16654  current = it.value().value;
16655  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorMinus : 0);
16656  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorPlus : 0);
16657  if ((current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) && current-currentErrorMinus < 0)
16658  {
16659  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
16660  haveLower = true;
16661  }
16662  if ((current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current+currentErrorPlus < 0)
16663  {
16664  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
16665  haveUpper = true;
16666  }
16667  if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars stretch beyond it, we still want to get that point.
16668  {
16669  if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current < 0)
16670  {
16671  range.lower = current;
16672  haveLower = true;
16673  }
16674  if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current < 0)
16675  {
16676  range.upper = current;
16677  haveUpper = true;
16678  }
16679  }
16680  ++it;
16681  }
16682  } else if (inSignDomain == sdPositive) // range may only be in the positive sign domain
16683  {
16684  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
16685  while (it != mData->constEnd())
16686  {
16687  current = it.value().value;
16688  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorMinus : 0);
16689  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorPlus : 0);
16690  if ((current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) && current-currentErrorMinus > 0)
16691  {
16692  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
16693  haveLower = true;
16694  }
16695  if ((current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current+currentErrorPlus > 0)
16696  {
16697  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
16698  haveUpper = true;
16699  }
16700  if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars stretch beyond it, we still want to geht that point.
16701  {
16702  if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current > 0)
16703  {
16704  range.lower = current;
16705  haveLower = true;
16706  }
16707  if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current > 0)
16708  {
16709  range.upper = current;
16710  haveUpper = true;
16711  }
16712  }
16713  ++it;
16714  }
16715  }
16716 
16717  foundRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
16718  return range;
16719 }
16720 
16721 
16725 
16742 QCPCurveData::QCPCurveData() :
16743  t(0),
16744  key(0),
16745  value(0)
16746 {
16747 }
16748 
16752 QCPCurveData::QCPCurveData(double t, double key, double value) :
16753  t(t),
16754  key(key),
16755  value(value)
16756 {
16757 }
16758 
16759 
16763 
16805 QCPCurve::QCPCurve(QCPAxis *keyAxis, QCPAxis *valueAxis) :
16806  QCPAbstractPlottable(keyAxis, valueAxis)
16807 {
16808  mData = new QCPCurveDataMap;
16809  mPen.setColor(Qt::blue);
16810  mPen.setStyle(Qt::SolidLine);
16811  mBrush.setColor(Qt::blue);
16812  mBrush.setStyle(Qt::NoBrush);
16813  mSelectedPen = mPen;
16814  mSelectedPen.setWidthF(2.5);
16815  mSelectedPen.setColor(QColor(80, 80, 255)); // lighter than Qt::blue of mPen
16816  mSelectedBrush = mBrush;
16817 
16818  setScatterStyle(QCPScatterStyle());
16819  setLineStyle(lsLine);
16820 }
16821 
16822 QCPCurve::~QCPCurve()
16823 {
16824  delete mData;
16825 }
16826 
16834 void QCPCurve::setData(QCPCurveDataMap *data, bool copy)
16835 {
16836  if (mData == data)
16837  {
16838  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "The data pointer is already in (and owned by) this plottable" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(data);
16839  return;
16840  }
16841  if (copy)
16842  {
16843  *mData = *data;
16844  } else
16845  {
16846  delete mData;
16847  mData = data;
16848  }
16849 }
16850 
16857 void QCPCurve::setData(const QVector<double> &t, const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value)
16858 {
16859  mData->clear();
16860  int n = t.size();
16861  n = qMin(n, key.size());
16862  n = qMin(n, value.size());
16863  QCPCurveData newData;
16864  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
16865  {
16866  newData.t = t[i];
16867  newData.key = key[i];
16868  newData.value = value[i];
16869  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
16870  }
16871 }
16872 
16878 void QCPCurve::setData(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value)
16879 {
16880  mData->clear();
16881  int n = key.size();
16882  n = qMin(n, value.size());
16883  QCPCurveData newData;
16884  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
16885  {
16886  newData.t = i; // no t vector given, so we assign t the index of the key/value pair
16887  newData.key = key[i];
16888  newData.value = value[i];
16889  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
16890  }
16891 }
16892 
16900 void QCPCurve::setScatterStyle(const QCPScatterStyle &style)
16901 {
16902  mScatterStyle = style;
16903 }
16904 
16912 void QCPCurve::setLineStyle(QCPCurve::LineStyle style)
16913 {
16914  mLineStyle = style;
16915 }
16916 
16921 void QCPCurve::addData(const QCPCurveDataMap &dataMap)
16922 {
16923  mData->unite(dataMap);
16924 }
16925 
16930 void QCPCurve::addData(const QCPCurveData &data)
16931 {
16932  mData->insertMulti(data.t, data);
16933 }
16934 
16939 void QCPCurve::addData(double t, double key, double value)
16940 {
16941  QCPCurveData newData;
16942  newData.t = t;
16943  newData.key = key;
16944  newData.value = value;
16945  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
16946 }
16947 
16956 void QCPCurve::addData(double key, double value)
16957 {
16958  QCPCurveData newData;
16959  if (!mData->isEmpty())
16960  newData.t = (mData->constEnd()-1).key()+1;
16961  else
16962  newData.t = 0;
16963  newData.key = key;
16964  newData.value = value;
16965  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
16966 }
16967 
16972 void QCPCurve::addData(const QVector<double> &ts, const QVector<double> &keys, const QVector<double> &values)
16973 {
16974  int n = ts.size();
16975  n = qMin(n, keys.size());
16976  n = qMin(n, values.size());
16977  QCPCurveData newData;
16978  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
16979  {
16980  newData.t = ts[i];
16981  newData.key = keys[i];
16982  newData.value = values[i];
16983  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
16984  }
16985 }
16986 
16991 void QCPCurve::removeDataBefore(double t)
16992 {
16993  QCPCurveDataMap::iterator it = mData->begin();
16994  while (it != mData->end() && it.key() < t)
16995  it = mData->erase(it);
16996 }
16997 
17002 void QCPCurve::removeDataAfter(double t)
17003 {
17004  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
17005  QCPCurveDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(t);
17006  while (it != mData->end())
17007  it = mData->erase(it);
17008 }
17009 
17017 void QCPCurve::removeData(double fromt, double tot)
17018 {
17019  if (fromt >= tot || mData->isEmpty()) return;
17020  QCPCurveDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(fromt);
17021  QCPCurveDataMap::iterator itEnd = mData->upperBound(tot);
17022  while (it != itEnd)
17023  it = mData->erase(it);
17024 }
17025 
17035 void QCPCurve::removeData(double t)
17036 {
17037  mData->remove(t);
17038 }
17039 
17044 void QCPCurve::clearData()
17045 {
17046  mData->clear();
17047 }
17048 
17049 /* inherits documentation from base class */
17050 double QCPCurve::selectTest(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable, QVariant *details) const
17051 {
17052  Q_UNUSED(details)
17053  if ((onlySelectable && !mSelectable) || mData->isEmpty())
17054  return -1;
17055  if (!mKeyAxis || !mValueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return -1; }
17056 
17057  if (mKeyAxis.data()->axisRect()->rect().contains(pos.toPoint()))
17058  return pointDistance(pos);
17059  else
17060  return -1;
17061 }
17062 
17063 /* inherits documentation from base class */
17064 void QCPCurve::draw(QCPPainter *painter)
17065 {
17066  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
17067 
17068  // allocate line vector:
17069  QVector<QPointF> *lineData = new QVector<QPointF>;
17070 
17071  // fill with curve data:
17072  getCurveData(lineData);
17073 
17074  // check data validity if flag set:
17075 #ifdef QCUSTOMPLOT_CHECK_DATA
17076  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator it;
17077  for (it = mData->constBegin(); it != mData->constEnd(); ++it)
17078  {
17079  if (QCP::isInvalidData(it.value().t) ||
17080  QCP::isInvalidData(it.value().key, it.value().value))
17081  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Data point at" << it.key() << "invalid." << "Plottable name:" << name();
17082  }
17083 #endif
17084 
17085  // draw curve fill:
17086  if (mainBrush().style() != Qt::NoBrush && mainBrush().color().alpha() != 0)
17087  {
17088  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
17089  painter->setPen(Qt::NoPen);
17090  painter->setBrush(mainBrush());
17091  painter->drawPolygon(QPolygonF(*lineData));
17092  }
17093 
17094  // draw curve line:
17095  if (mLineStyle != lsNone && mainPen().style() != Qt::NoPen && mainPen().color().alpha() != 0)
17096  {
17097  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
17098  painter->setPen(mainPen());
17099  painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
17100  // if drawing solid line and not in PDF, use much faster line drawing instead of polyline:
17101  if (mParentPlot->plottingHints().testFlag(QCP::phFastPolylines) &&
17102  painter->pen().style() == Qt::SolidLine &&
17103  !painter->modes().testFlag(QCPPainter::pmVectorized) &&
17104  !painter->modes().testFlag(QCPPainter::pmNoCaching))
17105  {
17106  int i = 1;
17107  int lineDataSize = lineData->size();
17108  while (i < lineDataSize)
17109  {
17110  if (!qIsNaN(lineData->at(i).y()) && !qIsNaN(lineData->at(i).x())) // NaNs create a gap in the line
17111  painter->drawLine(lineData->at(i-1), lineData->at(i));
17112  else
17113  ++i;
17114  ++i;
17115  }
17116  } else
17117  {
17118  int segmentStart = 0;
17119  int i = 0;
17120  int lineDataSize = lineData->size();
17121  while (i < lineDataSize)
17122  {
17123  if (qIsNaN(lineData->at(i).y()) || qIsNaN(lineData->at(i).x())) // NaNs create a gap in the line
17124  {
17125  painter->drawPolyline(lineData->constData()+segmentStart, i-segmentStart); // i, because we don't want to include the current NaN point
17126  segmentStart = i+1;
17127  }
17128  ++i;
17129  }
17130  // draw last segment:
17131  painter->drawPolyline(lineData->constData()+segmentStart, lineDataSize-segmentStart); // lineDataSize, because we do want to include the last point
17132  }
17133  }
17134 
17135  // draw scatters:
17136  if (!mScatterStyle.isNone())
17137  drawScatterPlot(painter, lineData);
17138 
17139  // free allocated line data:
17140  delete lineData;
17141 }
17142 
17143 /* inherits documentation from base class */
17144 void QCPCurve::drawLegendIcon(QCPPainter *painter, const QRectF &rect) const
17145 {
17146  // draw fill:
17147  if (mBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush)
17148  {
17149  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
17150  painter->fillRect(QRectF(rect.left(), rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0, rect.width(), rect.height()/3.0), mBrush);
17151  }
17152  // draw line vertically centered:
17153  if (mLineStyle != lsNone)
17154  {
17155  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
17156  painter->setPen(mPen);
17157  painter->drawLine(QLineF(rect.left(), rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0, rect.right()+5, rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0)); // +5 on x2 else last segment is missing from dashed/dotted pens
17158  }
17159  // draw scatter symbol:
17160  if (!mScatterStyle.isNone())
17161  {
17162  applyScattersAntialiasingHint(painter);
17163  // scale scatter pixmap if it's too large to fit in legend icon rect:
17164  if (mScatterStyle.shape() == QCPScatterStyle::ssPixmap && (mScatterStyle.pixmap().size().width() > rect.width() || mScatterStyle.pixmap().size().height() > rect.height()))
17165  {
17166  QCPScatterStyle scaledStyle(mScatterStyle);
17167  scaledStyle.setPixmap(scaledStyle.pixmap().scaled(rect.size().toSize(), Qt::KeepAspectRatio, Qt::SmoothTransformation));
17168  scaledStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
17169  scaledStyle.drawShape(painter, QRectF(rect).center());
17170  } else
17171  {
17172  mScatterStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
17173  mScatterStyle.drawShape(painter, QRectF(rect).center());
17174  }
17175  }
17176 }
17177 
17183 void QCPCurve::drawScatterPlot(QCPPainter *painter, const QVector<QPointF> *pointData) const
17184 {
17185  // draw scatter point symbols:
17186  applyScattersAntialiasingHint(painter);
17187  mScatterStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
17188  for (int i=0; i<pointData->size(); ++i)
17189  if (!qIsNaN(pointData->at(i).x()) && !qIsNaN(pointData->at(i).y()))
17190  mScatterStyle.drawShape(painter, pointData->at(i));
17191 }
17192 
17206 void QCPCurve::getCurveData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
17207 {
17208  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
17209  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
17210  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
17211 
17212  // add margins to rect to compensate for stroke width
17213  double strokeMargin = qMax(qreal(1.0), qreal(mainPen().widthF()*0.75)); // stroke radius + 50% safety
17214  if (!mScatterStyle.isNone())
17215  strokeMargin = qMax(strokeMargin, mScatterStyle.size());
17216  double rectLeft = keyAxis->pixelToCoord(keyAxis->coordToPixel(keyAxis->range().lower)-strokeMargin*((keyAxis->orientation()==Qt::Vertical)!=keyAxis->rangeReversed()?-1:1));
17217  double rectRight = keyAxis->pixelToCoord(keyAxis->coordToPixel(keyAxis->range().upper)+strokeMargin*((keyAxis->orientation()==Qt::Vertical)!=keyAxis->rangeReversed()?-1:1));
17218  double rectBottom = valueAxis->pixelToCoord(valueAxis->coordToPixel(valueAxis->range().lower)+strokeMargin*((valueAxis->orientation()==Qt::Horizontal)!=valueAxis->rangeReversed()?-1:1));
17219  double rectTop = valueAxis->pixelToCoord(valueAxis->coordToPixel(valueAxis->range().upper)-strokeMargin*((valueAxis->orientation()==Qt::Horizontal)!=valueAxis->rangeReversed()?-1:1));
17220  int currentRegion;
17221  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
17222  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator prevIt = mData->constEnd()-1;
17223  int prevRegion = getRegion(prevIt.value().key, prevIt.value().value, rectLeft, rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom);
17224  QVector<QPointF> trailingPoints; // points that must be applied after all other points (are generated only when handling first point to get virtual segment between last and first point right)
17225  while (it != mData->constEnd())
17226  {
17227  currentRegion = getRegion(it.value().key, it.value().value, rectLeft, rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom);
17228  if (currentRegion != prevRegion) // changed region, possibly need to add some optimized edge points or original points if entering R
17229  {
17230  if (currentRegion != 5) // segment doesn't end in R, so it's a candidate for removal
17231  {
17232  QPointF crossA, crossB;
17233  if (prevRegion == 5) // we're coming from R, so add this point optimized
17234  {
17235  lineData->append(getOptimizedPoint(currentRegion, it.value().key, it.value().value, prevIt.value().key, prevIt.value().value, rectLeft, rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom));
17236  // in the situations 5->1/7/9/3 the segment may leave R and directly cross through two outer regions. In these cases we need to add an additional corner point
17237  *lineData << getOptimizedCornerPoints(prevRegion, currentRegion, prevIt.value().key, prevIt.value().value, it.value().key, it.value().value, rectLeft, rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom);
17238  } else if (mayTraverse(prevRegion, currentRegion) &&
17239  getTraverse(prevIt.value().key, prevIt.value().value, it.value().key, it.value().value, rectLeft, rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom, crossA, crossB))
17240  {
17241  // add the two cross points optimized if segment crosses R and if segment isn't virtual zeroth segment between last and first curve point:
17242  QVector<QPointF> beforeTraverseCornerPoints, afterTraverseCornerPoints;
17243  getTraverseCornerPoints(prevRegion, currentRegion, rectLeft, rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom, beforeTraverseCornerPoints, afterTraverseCornerPoints);
17244  if (it != mData->constBegin())
17245  {
17246  *lineData << beforeTraverseCornerPoints;
17247  lineData->append(crossA);
17248  lineData->append(crossB);
17249  *lineData << afterTraverseCornerPoints;
17250  } else
17251  {
17252  lineData->append(crossB);
17253  *lineData << afterTraverseCornerPoints;
17254  trailingPoints << beforeTraverseCornerPoints << crossA ;
17255  }
17256  } else // doesn't cross R, line is just moving around in outside regions, so only need to add optimized point(s) at the boundary corner(s)
17257  {
17258  *lineData << getOptimizedCornerPoints(prevRegion, currentRegion, prevIt.value().key, prevIt.value().value, it.value().key, it.value().value, rectLeft, rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom);
17259  }
17260  } else // segment does end in R, so we add previous point optimized and this point at original position
17261  {
17262  if (it == mData->constBegin()) // it is first point in curve and prevIt is last one. So save optimized point for adding it to the lineData in the end
17263  trailingPoints << getOptimizedPoint(prevRegion, prevIt.value().key, prevIt.value().value, it.value().key, it.value().value, rectLeft, rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom);
17264  else
17265  lineData->append(getOptimizedPoint(prevRegion, prevIt.value().key, prevIt.value().value, it.value().key, it.value().value, rectLeft, rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom));
17266  lineData->append(coordsToPixels(it.value().key, it.value().value));
17267  }
17268  } else // region didn't change
17269  {
17270  if (currentRegion == 5) // still in R, keep adding original points
17271  {
17272  lineData->append(coordsToPixels(it.value().key, it.value().value));
17273  } else // still outside R, no need to add anything
17274  {
17275  // see how this is not doing anything? That's the main optimization...
17276  }
17277  }
17278  prevIt = it;
17279  prevRegion = currentRegion;
17280  ++it;
17281  }
17282  *lineData << trailingPoints;
17283 }
17284 
17303 int QCPCurve::getRegion(double x, double y, double rectLeft, double rectTop, double rectRight, double rectBottom) const
17304 {
17305  if (x < rectLeft) // region 123
17306  {
17307  if (y > rectTop)
17308  return 1;
17309  else if (y < rectBottom)
17310  return 3;
17311  else
17312  return 2;
17313  } else if (x > rectRight) // region 789
17314  {
17315  if (y > rectTop)
17316  return 7;
17317  else if (y < rectBottom)
17318  return 9;
17319  else
17320  return 8;
17321  } else // region 456
17322  {
17323  if (y > rectTop)
17324  return 4;
17325  else if (y < rectBottom)
17326  return 6;
17327  else
17328  return 5;
17329  }
17330 }
17331 
17347 QPointF QCPCurve::getOptimizedPoint(int otherRegion, double otherKey, double otherValue, double key, double value, double rectLeft, double rectTop, double rectRight, double rectBottom) const
17348 {
17349  double intersectKey = rectLeft; // initial value is just fail-safe
17350  double intersectValue = rectTop; // initial value is just fail-safe
17351  switch (otherRegion)
17352  {
17353  case 1: // top and left edge
17354  {
17355  intersectValue = rectTop;
17356  intersectKey = otherKey + (key-otherKey)/(value-otherValue)*(intersectValue-otherValue);
17357  if (intersectKey < rectLeft || intersectKey > rectRight) // doesn't intersect, so must intersect other:
17358  {
17359  intersectKey = rectLeft;
17360  intersectValue = otherValue + (value-otherValue)/(key-otherKey)*(intersectKey-otherKey);
17361  }
17362  break;
17363  }
17364  case 2: // left edge
17365  {
17366  intersectKey = rectLeft;
17367  intersectValue = otherValue + (value-otherValue)/(key-otherKey)*(intersectKey-otherKey);
17368  break;
17369  }
17370  case 3: // bottom and left edge
17371  {
17372  intersectValue = rectBottom;
17373  intersectKey = otherKey + (key-otherKey)/(value-otherValue)*(intersectValue-otherValue);
17374  if (intersectKey < rectLeft || intersectKey > rectRight) // doesn't intersect, so must intersect other:
17375  {
17376  intersectKey = rectLeft;
17377  intersectValue = otherValue + (value-otherValue)/(key-otherKey)*(intersectKey-otherKey);
17378  }
17379  break;
17380  }
17381  case 4: // top edge
17382  {
17383  intersectValue = rectTop;
17384  intersectKey = otherKey + (key-otherKey)/(value-otherValue)*(intersectValue-otherValue);
17385  break;
17386  }
17387  case 5:
17388  {
17389  break; // case 5 shouldn't happen for this function but we add it anyway to prevent potential discontinuity in branch table
17390  }
17391  case 6: // bottom edge
17392  {
17393  intersectValue = rectBottom;
17394  intersectKey = otherKey + (key-otherKey)/(value-otherValue)*(intersectValue-otherValue);
17395  break;
17396  }
17397  case 7: // top and right edge
17398  {
17399  intersectValue = rectTop;
17400  intersectKey = otherKey + (key-otherKey)/(value-otherValue)*(intersectValue-otherValue);
17401  if (intersectKey < rectLeft || intersectKey > rectRight) // doesn't intersect, so must intersect other:
17402  {
17403  intersectKey = rectRight;
17404  intersectValue = otherValue + (value-otherValue)/(key-otherKey)*(intersectKey-otherKey);
17405  }
17406  break;
17407  }
17408  case 8: // right edge
17409  {
17410  intersectKey = rectRight;
17411  intersectValue = otherValue + (value-otherValue)/(key-otherKey)*(intersectKey-otherKey);
17412  break;
17413  }
17414  case 9: // bottom and right edge
17415  {
17416  intersectValue = rectBottom;
17417  intersectKey = otherKey + (key-otherKey)/(value-otherValue)*(intersectValue-otherValue);
17418  if (intersectKey < rectLeft || intersectKey > rectRight) // doesn't intersect, so must intersect other:
17419  {
17420  intersectKey = rectRight;
17421  intersectValue = otherValue + (value-otherValue)/(key-otherKey)*(intersectKey-otherKey);
17422  }
17423  break;
17424  }
17425  }
17426  return coordsToPixels(intersectKey, intersectValue);
17427 }
17428 
17447 QVector<QPointF> QCPCurve::getOptimizedCornerPoints(int prevRegion, int currentRegion, double prevKey, double prevValue, double key, double value, double rectLeft, double rectTop, double rectRight, double rectBottom) const
17448 {
17449  QVector<QPointF> result;
17450  switch (prevRegion)
17451  {
17452  case 1:
17453  {
17454  switch (currentRegion)
17455  {
17456  case 2: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17457  case 4: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17458  case 3: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17459  case 7: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17460  case 6: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17461  case 8: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17462  case 9: { // in this case we need another distinction of cases: segment may pass below or above rect, requiring either bottom right or top left corner points
17463  if ((value-prevValue)/(key-prevKey)*(rectLeft-key)+value < rectBottom) // segment passes below R
17464  { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); }
17465  else
17466  { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); }
17467  break;
17468  }
17469  }
17470  break;
17471  }
17472  case 2:
17473  {
17474  switch (currentRegion)
17475  {
17476  case 1: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17477  case 3: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17478  case 4: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17479  case 6: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17480  case 7: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17481  case 9: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17482  }
17483  break;
17484  }
17485  case 3:
17486  {
17487  switch (currentRegion)
17488  {
17489  case 2: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17490  case 6: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17491  case 1: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17492  case 9: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17493  case 4: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17494  case 8: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17495  case 7: { // in this case we need another distinction of cases: segment may pass below or above rect, requiring either bottom right or top left corner points
17496  if ((value-prevValue)/(key-prevKey)*(rectRight-key)+value < rectBottom) // segment passes below R
17497  { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); }
17498  else
17499  { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); }
17500  break;
17501  }
17502  }
17503  break;
17504  }
17505  case 4:
17506  {
17507  switch (currentRegion)
17508  {
17509  case 1: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17510  case 7: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17511  case 2: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17512  case 8: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17513  case 3: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17514  case 9: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17515  }
17516  break;
17517  }
17518  case 5:
17519  {
17520  switch (currentRegion)
17521  {
17522  case 1: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17523  case 7: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17524  case 9: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17525  case 3: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17526  }
17527  break;
17528  }
17529  case 6:
17530  {
17531  switch (currentRegion)
17532  {
17533  case 3: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17534  case 9: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17535  case 2: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17536  case 8: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17537  case 1: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17538  case 7: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17539  }
17540  break;
17541  }
17542  case 7:
17543  {
17544  switch (currentRegion)
17545  {
17546  case 4: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17547  case 8: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17548  case 1: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17549  case 9: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17550  case 2: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17551  case 6: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17552  case 3: { // in this case we need another distinction of cases: segment may pass below or above rect, requiring either bottom right or top left corner points
17553  if ((value-prevValue)/(key-prevKey)*(rectRight-key)+value < rectBottom) // segment passes below R
17554  { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); }
17555  else
17556  { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); }
17557  break;
17558  }
17559  }
17560  break;
17561  }
17562  case 8:
17563  {
17564  switch (currentRegion)
17565  {
17566  case 7: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17567  case 9: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17568  case 4: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17569  case 6: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17570  case 1: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17571  case 3: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17572  }
17573  break;
17574  }
17575  case 9:
17576  {
17577  switch (currentRegion)
17578  {
17579  case 6: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17580  case 8: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17581  case 3: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17582  case 7: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17583  case 2: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17584  case 4: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17585  case 1: { // in this case we need another distinction of cases: segment may pass below or above rect, requiring either bottom right or top left corner points
17586  if ((value-prevValue)/(key-prevKey)*(rectLeft-key)+value < rectBottom) // segment passes below R
17587  { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); }
17588  else
17589  { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); }
17590  break;
17591  }
17592  }
17593  break;
17594  }
17595  }
17596  return result;
17597 }
17598 
17611 bool QCPCurve::mayTraverse(int prevRegion, int currentRegion) const
17612 {
17613  switch (prevRegion)
17614  {
17615  case 1:
17616  {
17617  switch (currentRegion)
17618  {
17619  case 4:
17620  case 7:
17621  case 2:
17622  case 3: return false;
17623  default: return true;
17624  }
17625  }
17626  case 2:
17627  {
17628  switch (currentRegion)
17629  {
17630  case 1:
17631  case 3: return false;
17632  default: return true;
17633  }
17634  }
17635  case 3:
17636  {
17637  switch (currentRegion)
17638  {
17639  case 1:
17640  case 2:
17641  case 6:
17642  case 9: return false;
17643  default: return true;
17644  }
17645  }
17646  case 4:
17647  {
17648  switch (currentRegion)
17649  {
17650  case 1:
17651  case 7: return false;
17652  default: return true;
17653  }
17654  }
17655  case 5: return false; // should never occur
17656  case 6:
17657  {
17658  switch (currentRegion)
17659  {
17660  case 3:
17661  case 9: return false;
17662  default: return true;
17663  }
17664  }
17665  case 7:
17666  {
17667  switch (currentRegion)
17668  {
17669  case 1:
17670  case 4:
17671  case 8:
17672  case 9: return false;
17673  default: return true;
17674  }
17675  }
17676  case 8:
17677  {
17678  switch (currentRegion)
17679  {
17680  case 7:
17681  case 9: return false;
17682  default: return true;
17683  }
17684  }
17685  case 9:
17686  {
17687  switch (currentRegion)
17688  {
17689  case 3:
17690  case 6:
17691  case 8:
17692  case 7: return false;
17693  default: return true;
17694  }
17695  }
17696  default: return true;
17697  }
17698 }
17699 
17700 
17714 bool QCPCurve::getTraverse(double prevKey, double prevValue, double key, double value, double rectLeft, double rectTop, double rectRight, double rectBottom, QPointF &crossA, QPointF &crossB) const
17715 {
17716  QList<QPointF> intersections; // x of QPointF corresponds to key and y to value
17717  if (qFuzzyIsNull(key-prevKey)) // line is parallel to value axis
17718  {
17719  // due to region filter in mayTraverseR(), if line is parallel to value or key axis, R is traversed here
17720  intersections.append(QPointF(key, rectBottom)); // direction will be taken care of at end of method
17721  intersections.append(QPointF(key, rectTop));
17722  } else if (qFuzzyIsNull(value-prevValue)) // line is parallel to key axis
17723  {
17724  // due to region filter in mayTraverseR(), if line is parallel to value or key axis, R is traversed here
17725  intersections.append(QPointF(rectLeft, value)); // direction will be taken care of at end of method
17726  intersections.append(QPointF(rectRight, value));
17727  } else // line is skewed
17728  {
17729  double gamma;
17730  double keyPerValue = (key-prevKey)/(value-prevValue);
17731  // check top of rect:
17732  gamma = prevKey + (rectTop-prevValue)*keyPerValue;
17733  if (gamma >= rectLeft && gamma <= rectRight)
17734  intersections.append(QPointF(gamma, rectTop));
17735  // check bottom of rect:
17736  gamma = prevKey + (rectBottom-prevValue)*keyPerValue;
17737  if (gamma >= rectLeft && gamma <= rectRight)
17738  intersections.append(QPointF(gamma, rectBottom));
17739  double valuePerKey = 1.0/keyPerValue;
17740  // check left of rect:
17741  gamma = prevValue + (rectLeft-prevKey)*valuePerKey;
17742  if (gamma >= rectBottom && gamma <= rectTop)
17743  intersections.append(QPointF(rectLeft, gamma));
17744  // check right of rect:
17745  gamma = prevValue + (rectRight-prevKey)*valuePerKey;
17746  if (gamma >= rectBottom && gamma <= rectTop)
17747  intersections.append(QPointF(rectRight, gamma));
17748  }
17749 
17750  // handle cases where found points isn't exactly 2:
17751  if (intersections.size() > 2)
17752  {
17753  // line probably goes through corner of rect, and we got duplicate points there. single out the point pair with greatest distance in between:
17754  double distSqrMax = 0;
17755  QPointF pv1, pv2;
17756  for (int i=0; i<intersections.size()-1; ++i)
17757  {
17758  for (int k=i+1; k<intersections.size(); ++k)
17759  {
17760  QPointF distPoint = intersections.at(i)-intersections.at(k);
17761  double distSqr = distPoint.x()*distPoint.x()+distPoint.y()+distPoint.y();
17762  if (distSqr > distSqrMax)
17763  {
17764  pv1 = intersections.at(i);
17765  pv2 = intersections.at(k);
17766  distSqrMax = distSqr;
17767  }
17768  }
17769  }
17770  intersections = QList<QPointF>() << pv1 << pv2;
17771  } else if (intersections.size() != 2)
17772  {
17773  // one or even zero points found (shouldn't happen unless line perfectly tangent to corner), no need to draw segment
17774  return false;
17775  }
17776 
17777  // possibly re-sort points so optimized point segment has same direction as original segment:
17778  if ((key-prevKey)*(intersections.at(1).x()-intersections.at(0).x()) + (value-prevValue)*(intersections.at(1).y()-intersections.at(0).y()) < 0) // scalar product of both segments < 0 -> opposite direction
17779  intersections.move(0, 1);
17780  crossA = coordsToPixels(intersections.at(0).x(), intersections.at(0).y());
17781  crossB = coordsToPixels(intersections.at(1).x(), intersections.at(1).y());
17782  return true;
17783 }
17784 
17810 void QCPCurve::getTraverseCornerPoints(int prevRegion, int currentRegion, double rectLeft, double rectTop, double rectRight, double rectBottom, QVector<QPointF> &beforeTraverse, QVector<QPointF> &afterTraverse) const
17811 {
17812  switch (prevRegion)
17813  {
17814  case 1:
17815  {
17816  switch (currentRegion)
17817  {
17818  case 6: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17819  case 9: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17820  case 8: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17821  }
17822  break;
17823  }
17824  case 2:
17825  {
17826  switch (currentRegion)
17827  {
17828  case 7: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17829  case 9: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17830  }
17831  break;
17832  }
17833  case 3:
17834  {
17835  switch (currentRegion)
17836  {
17837  case 4: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17838  case 7: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17839  case 8: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17840  }
17841  break;
17842  }
17843  case 4:
17844  {
17845  switch (currentRegion)
17846  {
17847  case 3: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17848  case 9: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17849  }
17850  break;
17851  }
17852  case 5: { break; } // shouldn't happen because this method only handles full traverses
17853  case 6:
17854  {
17855  switch (currentRegion)
17856  {
17857  case 1: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17858  case 7: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17859  }
17860  break;
17861  }
17862  case 7:
17863  {
17864  switch (currentRegion)
17865  {
17866  case 2: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17867  case 3: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17868  case 6: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17869  }
17870  break;
17871  }
17872  case 8:
17873  {
17874  switch (currentRegion)
17875  {
17876  case 1: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17877  case 3: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17878  }
17879  break;
17880  }
17881  case 9:
17882  {
17883  switch (currentRegion)
17884  {
17885  case 2: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17886  case 1: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17887  case 4: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17888  }
17889  break;
17890  }
17891  }
17892 }
17893 
17900 double QCPCurve::pointDistance(const QPointF &pixelPoint) const
17901 {
17902  if (mData->isEmpty())
17903  {
17904  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "requested point distance on curve" << mName << "without data";
17905  return 500;
17906  }
17907  if (mData->size() == 1)
17908  {
17909  QPointF dataPoint = coordsToPixels(mData->constBegin().key(), mData->constBegin().value().value);
17910  return QVector2D(dataPoint-pixelPoint).length();
17911  }
17912 
17913  // calculate minimum distance to line segments:
17914  QVector<QPointF> *lineData = new QVector<QPointF>;
17915  getCurveData(lineData);
17916  double minDistSqr = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
17917  for (int i=0; i<lineData->size()-1; ++i)
17918  {
17919  double currentDistSqr = distSqrToLine(lineData->at(i), lineData->at(i+1), pixelPoint);
17920  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
17921  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
17922  }
17923  delete lineData;
17924  return qSqrt(minDistSqr);
17925 }
17926 
17927 /* inherits documentation from base class */
17928 QCPRange QCPCurve::getKeyRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
17929 {
17930  QCPRange range;
17931  bool haveLower = false;
17932  bool haveUpper = false;
17933 
17934  double current;
17935 
17936  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
17937  while (it != mData->constEnd())
17938  {
17939  current = it.value().key;
17940  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth || (inSignDomain == sdNegative && current < 0) || (inSignDomain == sdPositive && current > 0))
17941  {
17942  if (current < range.lower || !haveLower)
17943  {
17944  range.lower = current;
17945  haveLower = true;
17946  }
17947  if (current > range.upper || !haveUpper)
17948  {
17949  range.upper = current;
17950  haveUpper = true;
17951  }
17952  }
17953  ++it;
17954  }
17955 
17956  foundRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
17957  return range;
17958 }
17959 
17960 /* inherits documentation from base class */
17961 QCPRange QCPCurve::getValueRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
17962 {
17963  QCPRange range;
17964  bool haveLower = false;
17965  bool haveUpper = false;
17966 
17967  double current;
17968 
17969  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
17970  while (it != mData->constEnd())
17971  {
17972  current = it.value().value;
17973  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth || (inSignDomain == sdNegative && current < 0) || (inSignDomain == sdPositive && current > 0))
17974  {
17975  if (current < range.lower || !haveLower)
17976  {
17977  range.lower = current;
17978  haveLower = true;
17979  }
17980  if (current > range.upper || !haveUpper)
17981  {
17982  range.upper = current;
17983  haveUpper = true;
17984  }
17985  }
17986  ++it;
17987  }
17988 
17989  foundRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
17990  return range;
17991 }
17992 
17993 
17997 
18031 /* start of documentation of inline functions */
18032 
18059 /* end of documentation of inline functions */
18060 
18064 QCPBarsGroup::QCPBarsGroup(QCustomPlot *parentPlot) :
18065  QObject(parentPlot),
18066  mParentPlot(parentPlot),
18067  mSpacingType(stAbsolute),
18068  mSpacing(4)
18069 {
18070 }
18071 
18072 QCPBarsGroup::~QCPBarsGroup()
18073 {
18074  clear();
18075 }
18076 
18084 void QCPBarsGroup::setSpacingType(SpacingType spacingType)
18085 {
18086  mSpacingType = spacingType;
18087 }
18088 
18095 void QCPBarsGroup::setSpacing(double spacing)
18096 {
18097  mSpacing = spacing;
18098 }
18099 
18106 QCPBars *QCPBarsGroup::bars(int index) const
18107 {
18108  if (index >= 0 && index < mBars.size())
18109  {
18110  return mBars.at(index);
18111  } else
18112  {
18113  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "index out of bounds:" << index;
18114  return 0;
18115  }
18116 }
18117 
18123 void QCPBarsGroup::clear()
18124 {
18125  foreach (QCPBars *bars, mBars) // since foreach takes a copy, removing bars in the loop is okay
18126  bars->setBarsGroup(0); // removes itself via removeBars
18127 }
18128 
18135 void QCPBarsGroup::append(QCPBars *bars)
18136 {
18137  if (!bars)
18138  {
18139  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "bars is 0";
18140  return;
18141  }
18142 
18143  if (!mBars.contains(bars))
18144  bars->setBarsGroup(this);
18145  else
18146  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "bars plottable is already in this bars group:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(bars);
18147 }
18148 
18158 void QCPBarsGroup::insert(int i, QCPBars *bars)
18159 {
18160  if (!bars)
18161  {
18162  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "bars is 0";
18163  return;
18164  }
18165 
18166  // first append to bars list normally:
18167  if (!mBars.contains(bars))
18168  bars->setBarsGroup(this);
18169  // then move to according position:
18170  mBars.move(mBars.indexOf(bars), qBound(0, i, mBars.size()-1));
18171 }
18172 
18178 void QCPBarsGroup::remove(QCPBars *bars)
18179 {
18180  if (!bars)
18181  {
18182  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "bars is 0";
18183  return;
18184  }
18185 
18186  if (mBars.contains(bars))
18187  bars->setBarsGroup(0);
18188  else
18189  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "bars plottable is not in this bars group:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(bars);
18190 }
18191 
18199 void QCPBarsGroup::registerBars(QCPBars *bars)
18200 {
18201  if (!mBars.contains(bars))
18202  mBars.append(bars);
18203 }
18204 
18212 void QCPBarsGroup::unregisterBars(QCPBars *bars)
18213 {
18214  mBars.removeOne(bars);
18215 }
18216 
18223 double QCPBarsGroup::keyPixelOffset(const QCPBars *bars, double keyCoord)
18224 {
18225  // find list of all base bars in case some mBars are stacked:
18226  QList<const QCPBars*> baseBars;
18227  foreach (const QCPBars *b, mBars)
18228  {
18229  while (b->barBelow())
18230  b = b->barBelow();
18231  if (!baseBars.contains(b))
18232  baseBars.append(b);
18233  }
18234  // find base bar this "bars" is stacked on:
18235  const QCPBars *thisBase = bars;
18236  while (thisBase->barBelow())
18237  thisBase = thisBase->barBelow();
18238 
18239  // determine key pixel offset of this base bars considering all other base bars in this barsgroup:
18240  double result = 0;
18241  int index = baseBars.indexOf(thisBase);
18242  if (index >= 0)
18243  {
18244  int startIndex;
18245  double lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth;
18246  if (baseBars.size() % 2 == 1 && index == (baseBars.size()-1)/2) // is center bar (int division on purpose)
18247  {
18248  return result;
18249  } else if (index < (baseBars.size()-1)/2.0) // bar is to the left of center
18250  {
18251  if (baseBars.size() % 2 == 0) // even number of bars
18252  {
18253  startIndex = baseBars.size()/2-1;
18254  result -= getPixelSpacing(baseBars.at(startIndex), keyCoord)*0.5; // half of middle spacing
18255  } else // uneven number of bars
18256  {
18257  startIndex = (baseBars.size()-1)/2-1;
18258  baseBars.at((baseBars.size()-1)/2)->getPixelWidth(keyCoord, lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth);
18259  result -= qAbs(upperPixelWidth-lowerPixelWidth)*0.5; // half of center bar
18260  result -= getPixelSpacing(baseBars.at((baseBars.size()-1)/2), keyCoord); // center bar spacing
18261  }
18262  for (int i=startIndex; i>index; --i) // add widths and spacings of bars in between center and our bars
18263  {
18264  baseBars.at(i)->getPixelWidth(keyCoord, lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth);
18265  result -= qAbs(upperPixelWidth-lowerPixelWidth);
18266  result -= getPixelSpacing(baseBars.at(i), keyCoord);
18267  }
18268  // finally half of our bars width:
18269  baseBars.at(index)->getPixelWidth(keyCoord, lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth);
18270  result -= qAbs(upperPixelWidth-lowerPixelWidth)*0.5;
18271  } else // bar is to the right of center
18272  {
18273  if (baseBars.size() % 2 == 0) // even number of bars
18274  {
18275  startIndex = baseBars.size()/2;
18276  result += getPixelSpacing(baseBars.at(startIndex), keyCoord)*0.5; // half of middle spacing
18277  } else // uneven number of bars
18278  {
18279  startIndex = (baseBars.size()-1)/2+1;
18280  baseBars.at((baseBars.size()-1)/2)->getPixelWidth(keyCoord, lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth);
18281  result += qAbs(upperPixelWidth-lowerPixelWidth)*0.5; // half of center bar
18282  result += getPixelSpacing(baseBars.at((baseBars.size()-1)/2), keyCoord); // center bar spacing
18283  }
18284  for (int i=startIndex; i<index; ++i) // add widths and spacings of bars in between center and our bars
18285  {
18286  baseBars.at(i)->getPixelWidth(keyCoord, lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth);
18287  result += qAbs(upperPixelWidth-lowerPixelWidth);
18288  result += getPixelSpacing(baseBars.at(i), keyCoord);
18289  }
18290  // finally half of our bars width:
18291  baseBars.at(index)->getPixelWidth(keyCoord, lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth);
18292  result += qAbs(upperPixelWidth-lowerPixelWidth)*0.5;
18293  }
18294  }
18295  return result;
18296 }
18297 
18308 double QCPBarsGroup::getPixelSpacing(const QCPBars *bars, double keyCoord)
18309 {
18310  switch (mSpacingType)
18311  {
18312  case stAbsolute:
18313  {
18314  return mSpacing;
18315  }
18316  case stAxisRectRatio:
18317  {
18318  if (bars->keyAxis()->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
18319  return bars->keyAxis()->axisRect()->width()*mSpacing;
18320  else
18321  return bars->keyAxis()->axisRect()->height()*mSpacing;
18322  }
18323  case stPlotCoords:
18324  {
18325  double keyPixel = bars->keyAxis()->coordToPixel(keyCoord);
18326  return bars->keyAxis()->coordToPixel(keyCoord+mSpacing)-keyPixel;
18327  }
18328  }
18329  return 0;
18330 }
18331 
18332 
18336 
18352 QCPBarData::QCPBarData() :
18353  key(0),
18354  value(0)
18355 {
18356 }
18357 
18361 QCPBarData::QCPBarData(double key, double value) :
18362  key(key),
18363  value(value)
18364 {
18365 }
18366 
18367 
18371 
18411 /* start of documentation of inline functions */
18412 
18427 /* end of documentation of inline functions */
18428 
18438 QCPBars::QCPBars(QCPAxis *keyAxis, QCPAxis *valueAxis) :
18439  QCPAbstractPlottable(keyAxis, valueAxis),
18440  mData(new QCPBarDataMap),
18441  mWidth(0.75),
18442  mWidthType(wtPlotCoords),
18443  mBarsGroup(0),
18444  mBaseValue(0)
18445 {
18446  // modify inherited properties from abstract plottable:
18447  mPen.setColor(Qt::blue);
18448  mPen.setStyle(Qt::SolidLine);
18449  mBrush.setColor(QColor(40, 50, 255, 30));
18450  mBrush.setStyle(Qt::SolidPattern);
18451  mSelectedPen = mPen;
18452  mSelectedPen.setWidthF(2.5);
18453  mSelectedPen.setColor(QColor(80, 80, 255)); // lighter than Qt::blue of mPen
18454  mSelectedBrush = mBrush;
18455 }
18456 
18457 QCPBars::~QCPBars()
18458 {
18459  setBarsGroup(0);
18460  if (mBarBelow || mBarAbove)
18461  connectBars(mBarBelow.data(), mBarAbove.data()); // take this bar out of any stacking
18462  delete mData;
18463 }
18464 
18471 void QCPBars::setWidth(double width)
18472 {
18473  mWidth = width;
18474 }
18475 
18484 void QCPBars::setWidthType(QCPBars::WidthType widthType)
18485 {
18486  mWidthType = widthType;
18487 }
18488 
18495 void QCPBars::setBarsGroup(QCPBarsGroup *barsGroup)
18496 {
18497  // deregister at old group:
18498  if (mBarsGroup)
18499  mBarsGroup->unregisterBars(this);
18500  mBarsGroup = barsGroup;
18501  // register at new group:
18502  if (mBarsGroup)
18503  mBarsGroup->registerBars(this);
18504 }
18505 
18518 void QCPBars::setBaseValue(double baseValue)
18519 {
18520  mBaseValue = baseValue;
18521 }
18522 
18530 void QCPBars::setData(QCPBarDataMap *data, bool copy)
18531 {
18532  if (mData == data)
18533  {
18534  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "The data pointer is already in (and owned by) this plottable" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(data);
18535  return;
18536  }
18537  if (copy)
18538  {
18539  *mData = *data;
18540  } else
18541  {
18542  delete mData;
18543  mData = data;
18544  }
18545 }
18546 
18553 void QCPBars::setData(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value)
18554 {
18555  mData->clear();
18556  int n = key.size();
18557  n = qMin(n, value.size());
18558  QCPBarData newData;
18559  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
18560  {
18561  newData.key = key[i];
18562  newData.value = value[i];
18563  mData->insertMulti(newData.key, newData);
18564  }
18565 }
18566 
18581 void QCPBars::moveBelow(QCPBars *bars)
18582 {
18583  if (bars == this) return;
18584  if (bars && (bars->keyAxis() != mKeyAxis.data() || bars->valueAxis() != mValueAxis.data()))
18585  {
18586  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "passed QCPBars* doesn't have same key and value axis as this QCPBars";
18587  return;
18588  }
18589  // remove from stacking:
18590  connectBars(mBarBelow.data(), mBarAbove.data()); // Note: also works if one (or both) of them is 0
18591  // if new bar given, insert this bar below it:
18592  if (bars)
18593  {
18594  if (bars->mBarBelow)
18595  connectBars(bars->mBarBelow.data(), this);
18596  connectBars(this, bars);
18597  }
18598 }
18599 
18614 void QCPBars::moveAbove(QCPBars *bars)
18615 {
18616  if (bars == this) return;
18617  if (bars && (bars->keyAxis() != mKeyAxis.data() || bars->valueAxis() != mValueAxis.data()))
18618  {
18619  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "passed QCPBars* doesn't have same key and value axis as this QCPBars";
18620  return;
18621  }
18622  // remove from stacking:
18623  connectBars(mBarBelow.data(), mBarAbove.data()); // Note: also works if one (or both) of them is 0
18624  // if new bar given, insert this bar above it:
18625  if (bars)
18626  {
18627  if (bars->mBarAbove)
18628  connectBars(this, bars->mBarAbove.data());
18629  connectBars(bars, this);
18630  }
18631 }
18632 
18637 void QCPBars::addData(const QCPBarDataMap &dataMap)
18638 {
18639  mData->unite(dataMap);
18640 }
18641 
18646 void QCPBars::addData(const QCPBarData &data)
18647 {
18648  mData->insertMulti(data.key, data);
18649 }
18650 
18655 void QCPBars::addData(double key, double value)
18656 {
18657  QCPBarData newData;
18658  newData.key = key;
18659  newData.value = value;
18660  mData->insertMulti(newData.key, newData);
18661 }
18662 
18667 void QCPBars::addData(const QVector<double> &keys, const QVector<double> &values)
18668 {
18669  int n = keys.size();
18670  n = qMin(n, values.size());
18671  QCPBarData newData;
18672  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
18673  {
18674  newData.key = keys[i];
18675  newData.value = values[i];
18676  mData->insertMulti(newData.key, newData);
18677  }
18678 }
18679 
18684 void QCPBars::removeDataBefore(double key)
18685 {
18686  QCPBarDataMap::iterator it = mData->begin();
18687  while (it != mData->end() && it.key() < key)
18688  it = mData->erase(it);
18689 }
18690 
18695 void QCPBars::removeDataAfter(double key)
18696 {
18697  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
18698  QCPBarDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(key);
18699  while (it != mData->end())
18700  it = mData->erase(it);
18701 }
18702 
18710 void QCPBars::removeData(double fromKey, double toKey)
18711 {
18712  if (fromKey >= toKey || mData->isEmpty()) return;
18713  QCPBarDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(fromKey);
18714  QCPBarDataMap::iterator itEnd = mData->upperBound(toKey);
18715  while (it != itEnd)
18716  it = mData->erase(it);
18717 }
18718 
18727 void QCPBars::removeData(double key)
18728 {
18729  mData->remove(key);
18730 }
18731 
18736 void QCPBars::clearData()
18737 {
18738  mData->clear();
18739 }
18740 
18741 /* inherits documentation from base class */
18742 double QCPBars::selectTest(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable, QVariant *details) const
18743 {
18744  Q_UNUSED(details)
18745  if (onlySelectable && !mSelectable)
18746  return -1;
18747  if (!mKeyAxis || !mValueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return -1; }
18748 
18749  if (mKeyAxis.data()->axisRect()->rect().contains(pos.toPoint()))
18750  {
18751  QCPBarDataMap::ConstIterator it;
18752  for (it = mData->constBegin(); it != mData->constEnd(); ++it)
18753  {
18754  if (getBarPolygon(it.value().key, it.value().value).boundingRect().contains(pos))
18755  return mParentPlot->selectionTolerance()*0.99;
18756  }
18757  }
18758  return -1;
18759 }
18760 
18761 /* inherits documentation from base class */
18762 void QCPBars::draw(QCPPainter *painter)
18763 {
18764  if (!mKeyAxis || !mValueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
18765  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
18766 
18767  QCPBarDataMap::const_iterator it, lower, upperEnd;
18768  getVisibleDataBounds(lower, upperEnd);
18769  for (it = lower; it != upperEnd; ++it)
18770  {
18771  // check data validity if flag set:
18772 #ifdef QCUSTOMPLOT_CHECK_DATA
18773  if (QCP::isInvalidData(it.value().key, it.value().value))
18774  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Data point at" << it.key() << "of drawn range invalid." << "Plottable name:" << name();
18775 #endif
18776  QPolygonF barPolygon = getBarPolygon(it.key(), it.value().value);
18777  // draw bar fill:
18778  if (mainBrush().style() != Qt::NoBrush && mainBrush().color().alpha() != 0)
18779  {
18780  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
18781  painter->setPen(Qt::NoPen);
18782  painter->setBrush(mainBrush());
18783  painter->drawPolygon(barPolygon);
18784  }
18785  // draw bar line:
18786  if (mainPen().style() != Qt::NoPen && mainPen().color().alpha() != 0)
18787  {
18788  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
18789  painter->setPen(mainPen());
18790  painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
18791  painter->drawPolyline(barPolygon);
18792  }
18793  }
18794 }
18795 
18796 /* inherits documentation from base class */
18797 void QCPBars::drawLegendIcon(QCPPainter *painter, const QRectF &rect) const
18798 {
18799  // draw filled rect:
18800  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
18801  painter->setBrush(mBrush);
18802  painter->setPen(mPen);
18803  QRectF r = QRectF(0, 0, rect.width()*0.67, rect.height()*0.67);
18804  r.moveCenter(rect.center());
18805  painter->drawRect(r);
18806 }
18807 
18822 void QCPBars::getVisibleDataBounds(QCPBarDataMap::const_iterator &lower, QCPBarDataMap::const_iterator &upperEnd) const
18823 {
18824  if (!mKeyAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key axis"; return; }
18825  if (mData->isEmpty())
18826  {
18827  lower = mData->constEnd();
18828  upperEnd = mData->constEnd();
18829  return;
18830  }
18831 
18832  // get visible data range as QMap iterators
18833  lower = mData->lowerBound(mKeyAxis.data()->range().lower);
18834  upperEnd = mData->upperBound(mKeyAxis.data()->range().upper);
18835  double lowerPixelBound = mKeyAxis.data()->coordToPixel(mKeyAxis.data()->range().lower);
18836  double upperPixelBound = mKeyAxis.data()->coordToPixel(mKeyAxis.data()->range().upper);
18837  bool isVisible = false;
18838  // walk left from lbound to find lower bar that actually is completely outside visible pixel range:
18839  QCPBarDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
18840  while (it != mData->constBegin())
18841  {
18842  --it;
18843  QRectF barBounds = getBarPolygon(it.value().key, it.value().value).boundingRect();
18844  if (mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
18845  isVisible = ((!mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barBounds.right() >= lowerPixelBound) || (mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barBounds.left() <= lowerPixelBound));
18846  else // keyaxis is vertical
18847  isVisible = ((!mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barBounds.top() <= lowerPixelBound) || (mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barBounds.bottom() >= lowerPixelBound));
18848  if (isVisible)
18849  lower = it;
18850  else
18851  break;
18852  }
18853  // walk right from ubound to find upper bar that actually is completely outside visible pixel range:
18854  it = upperEnd;
18855  while (it != mData->constEnd())
18856  {
18857  QRectF barBounds = getBarPolygon(upperEnd.value().key, upperEnd.value().value).boundingRect();
18858  if (mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
18859  isVisible = ((!mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barBounds.left() <= upperPixelBound) || (mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barBounds.right() >= upperPixelBound));
18860  else // keyaxis is vertical
18861  isVisible = ((!mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barBounds.bottom() >= upperPixelBound) || (mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barBounds.top() <= upperPixelBound));
18862  if (isVisible)
18863  upperEnd = it+1;
18864  else
18865  break;
18866  ++it;
18867  }
18868 }
18869 
18876 QPolygonF QCPBars::getBarPolygon(double key, double value) const
18877 {
18878  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
18879  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
18880  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return QPolygonF(); }
18881 
18882  QPolygonF result;
18883  double lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth;
18884  getPixelWidth(key, lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth);
18885  double base = getStackedBaseValue(key, value >= 0);
18886  double basePixel = valueAxis->coordToPixel(base);
18887  double valuePixel = valueAxis->coordToPixel(base+value);
18888  double keyPixel = keyAxis->coordToPixel(key);
18889  if (mBarsGroup)
18890  keyPixel += mBarsGroup->keyPixelOffset(this, key);
18891  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
18892  {
18893  result << QPointF(keyPixel+lowerPixelWidth, basePixel);
18894  result << QPointF(keyPixel+lowerPixelWidth, valuePixel);
18895  result << QPointF(keyPixel+upperPixelWidth, valuePixel);
18896  result << QPointF(keyPixel+upperPixelWidth, basePixel);
18897  } else
18898  {
18899  result << QPointF(basePixel, keyPixel+lowerPixelWidth);
18900  result << QPointF(valuePixel, keyPixel+lowerPixelWidth);
18901  result << QPointF(valuePixel, keyPixel+upperPixelWidth);
18902  result << QPointF(basePixel, keyPixel+upperPixelWidth);
18903  }
18904  return result;
18905 }
18906 
18916 void QCPBars::getPixelWidth(double key, double &lower, double &upper) const
18917 {
18918  switch (mWidthType)
18919  {
18920  case wtAbsolute:
18921  {
18922  upper = mWidth*0.5;
18923  lower = -upper;
18924  if (mKeyAxis && (mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() ^ (mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)))
18925  qSwap(lower, upper);
18926  break;
18927  }
18928  case wtAxisRectRatio:
18929  {
18930  if (mKeyAxis && mKeyAxis.data()->axisRect())
18931  {
18932  if (mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
18933  upper = mKeyAxis.data()->axisRect()->width()*mWidth*0.5;
18934  else
18935  upper = mKeyAxis.data()->axisRect()->height()*mWidth*0.5;
18936  lower = -upper;
18937  if (mKeyAxis && (mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() ^ (mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)))
18938  qSwap(lower, upper);
18939  } else
18940  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "No key axis or axis rect defined";
18941  break;
18942  }
18943  case wtPlotCoords:
18944  {
18945  if (mKeyAxis)
18946  {
18947  double keyPixel = mKeyAxis.data()->coordToPixel(key);
18948  upper = mKeyAxis.data()->coordToPixel(key+mWidth*0.5)-keyPixel;
18949  lower = mKeyAxis.data()->coordToPixel(key-mWidth*0.5)-keyPixel;
18950  // no need to qSwap(lower, higher) when range reversed, because higher/lower are gained by
18951  // coordinate transform which includes range direction
18952  } else
18953  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "No key axis defined";
18954  break;
18955  }
18956  }
18957 }
18958 
18968 double QCPBars::getStackedBaseValue(double key, bool positive) const
18969 {
18970  if (mBarBelow)
